subject: Business
title: Crossing the Chasm
description: A micro-lesson that makes Crossing the Chasm usable.

hook.text: Your early adopters love you. Mainstream customers don't care. There's a chasm between them.

buildup.text: Geoffrey Moore showed that tech adoption has a dangerous gap between early and mainstream users.

discovery.text: Early adopters tolerate bugs and half-built products. The majority demands polish and social proof.

twist.text: Many startups stall at a few thousand users. They saturated early adopters but can't cross over.

climax.text: The strategy: pick one mainstream niche, dominate it completely, then expand outward.

punchline.text: Don't try to please everyone. Win one beachhead first.

quiz.question: What is the 'chasm' in technology adoption?
options: The gap between early adopters and the mainstream majority
The gap between idea and launch
